headline: Why Hurricane Dorian Is So Hard to Track
summary: The ultimate path of Hurricane Dorian is challenging to predict, experts say, because the storm and others like it are guided by many ever-changing elements.

headline: Naomi Osaka Overwhelms Coco Gauff at the U.S. Open
summary: Naomi Osaka, the world’s No. 1-ranked player, ended the run of 15-year-old Coco Gauff in the third round of the U.S. Open with a 6-3, 6-0 win that took a little over an hour.

headline: Dorian Could Test Aging Infrastructure at Florida’s Largest Lake
summary: Hurricane Dorian could test the aging flood-control system around Lake Okeechobee in southern Florida, as rising water levels strain a dike vulnerable to seepage.

headline: RAIT Financial Trust Files for Bankruptcy
summary: The Philadelphia-based real-estate investment trust has filed for chapter 11 bankruptcy and said it plans to sell its assets to a buyer affiliated with Fortress Investment Group for $174.4 million.

headline: Ginsburg: Supreme Court Work Keeps Me Going
summary: Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg sought Saturday to dispel concerns over her health, telling a packed audience at the National Book Festival that she was readying to plunge into the Supreme Court term opening October.

headline: Deluxe Entertainment Reaches Deal on Debt-for-Equity Swap With Lenders
summary: Deluxe Entertainment Services, the video-services company backed by financier Ronald Perelman, has reached a deal on the terms of a debt-for-equity swap that will hand control of the company to its senior lenders.

headline: Final Indian Citizenship List Could Leave Nearly Two Million Stateless
summary: India published a final list of its citizens in the northeastern state of Assam, leaving out the names of almost two million residents who now face the possibility of being denied citizenship.

headline: Markets Show Resilience in Topsy-Turvy August
summary: Stocks capped off a volatile August down only slightly for the month and near recent records, the latest example of the bull market’s stability despite global threats.

headline: Bubble Tea Now Comes With a Little Kick
summary: A growing number of shops specializing in the Asian favorite, which combines tea with tapioca pearls, are opening throughout the metropolitan region.

headline: The Horsemen Stalking the Korean Stock Market
summary: South Korean President Moon Jae-in has made a public display of personal support for Korean companies, but investors would be unwise to follow his example.

headline: Hurricane Dorian to Test Florida’s New Nursing-Home Power Rules
summary: Hurricane Dorian, on a path toward Florida as a Category 4 storm, may be the most significant test of the state’s nearly two-year push to bolster emergency power at nursing homes, which the industry has been slow to adopt.

headline: Hong Kong Protesters and Police Clash in 13th Week of Demonstrations
summary: Antigovernment demonstrations stretched into their 13th weekend as police mobilized water cannons and tear gas to disperse protesters.

headline: ‘Homer at the Beach: A Marine Painter’s Journey, 1869-1880’ Review: Flotsam, Jetsam, Handsome
summary: An intimate look at the artist’s seaside work made during the early part of his career is augmented with historical objects and ephemera that lend useful context to the show.

headline: Bank of Jinzhou Posts Net Loss After Filing Delay
summary: Hong Kong-listed lender Bank of Jinzhou reported a net loss, citing increased bad loans and a change of accounting measures that have more-stringent requirements on loan impairment.

headline: What’s News: Business & Finance
summary: What’s News: Business & Finance

headline: The Problem With Believing What We’re Told
summary: In an age of information overload, it’s important to find ways to resist the brain’s difficulty in separating fact from falsehood.

headline: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Pepper...and Salt

headline: What’s News: World-Wide
summary: What’s News: World-Wide

headline: Democrats Step Up Offensive Against Mitch McConnell
summary: Democrats have launched a nationwide effort to raise funds by painting Mitch McConnell as the reason progressive legislation has stalled. The Senate majority leader, meanwhile, has embraced the persona of villain of the left.

headline: Sen. Young Boosts Profile as Contrarian Foreign-Policy Voice
summary: In a party where regularly opposing the president often results in a primary challenge or early retirement, Republican Sen. Todd Young has made the risky decision to become a high-profile skeptic of Saudi Arabia, one of the administration’s key allies.

headline: Europe’s Winemakers Break With Tradition as Temperatures Rise
summary: Volatile weather in Europe is wreaking havoc on wine country, forcing vineyards long used to serene summers to experiment with new varietals and higher elevations, and prompting fears the region’s wines may lose some of their recognizable flavors.

headline: ‘I Thought the World Was Ending’: What’s Fueling the Amazon Rainforest Fires
summary: Deforestation has been rising since 2015 as Brazil’s recession pushed poorer Brazilians into illegal logging. More than 43,000 fires have burned in the region this year, pitting environmentalists against a defiant president and reviving conspiracy theories about foreign interference.

headline: The Next Hot Job: Pretending to Be a Robot
summary: Until the techno-utopian dream of full automation is realized, the growth of not-yet-autonomous technologies is creating opportunities for humans to help operate robots remotely, sometimes from thousands of miles away.
